reviewText:
Super Mega Neo Pug is one of those simple yet addictive 2d endless runner games. There‚Äôs nothing different about it, it‚Äôs pretty fun with some some catchy music and some nice themes going on. This review won‚Äôt be long since there isn‚Äôt much to talk about with this type of game, you can just see the video below which is self-explanatory how this game is. It‚Äôs a very simple game but its too addictive at the same time.

Gameplay is straight forward, you‚Äôre constantly moving and holding the mouse button will make you fly up and if you let go of the button you descend down and if you end up at the bottom of the screen, you die. There‚Äôs stuff flying everywhere including birds, bees, ice cubes(what?), snow balls, comets, rocks etc. There‚Äôs boss fights too where a boos would appear and throw things at you and you have to dodge them. There are coins too which you can collect as well as some power pickups like a magnet which will collect coins even if you don‚Äôt go through them. The other power-up is a shield which makes you invulnerable for a short time and anything you touch will die.

Every time you start a game there‚Äôs a different theme every time. Some these include Egyptian theme, Space theme, Winter snowing theme etc. Other than that you can unlock new characters such as Santa pug, Sombrero wearing pug, a panda, a dragon, a hamster etc.

The sound in this game is so cute and especially the different themes‚Äô music sound really relevant to their themes.

Conclusion: Cute game, cute music, addictive gameplay and only 99 cents (as of this review it‚Äôs 40% off and 59 cents), it‚Äôs a bargain. Even if you play 2 hours, it‚Äôs worth it.

Gameplay video below:

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=682548308

reviewText:
This and Turbo Pug were 2 dollars that I don't regret spending.
I would buy any pug game from this developers.
It's good ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•. Buy it.

Now the serious  and less funny  review.

Super Mega Neo Pug is the game about the pugs from the first game, Turbo Pug, flying and avoiding various obstacles and bosses, getting coins and collectibles. Not gonna ask how are the pugs flying. Still good.
The game is great, and it gives you a lot more freedom and content than the first game.
I can't say that there's not enough content, since the game was released 9 days ago, so I don't expect a game full of content, but I still hope the game gets updated.
In my opinion, this game is harder than the first one, sure, it gives you more space to move, but there's more obstacles and patters almost impossible to do.
Getting the pugs and items it's pretty fun, though.
So.

Pros
There's pugs. Lots of pugs to get. Needs more. More pugs.
Nice power-ups to pick and make the game a bit less impossible.
4 nice different biomes: Snowy, Grassy, Sandy and Space biomes.
Good soundtrack, my favorite song is Space Sprint.

Cons
Not much content???????
Hard as ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•.
Both soundtrack and gameplay get really repetitive after a while.
It doesn't tell you how many coins you need to get a character, so you have to pick up some coins and then be sad because you didn't get the pug with the mexican hat.  by the way i love the mexican hat pug thank you guys so much i love you
9/10.
Needs more pugs.

reviewText: Super Mega Neo Pug is a fun arcade style game where you dodge various obstacles while flying through a level. It's very entertaining and tough. Practice is required to make it to each boss, which adds to the satisfaction when you finally beat him (I still hate the cat boss the most). The music is also fantastic and suits the enviornments well. The developers are very active and post regular updates. I would recommend this game to anyone who loves to compete against their friends to get a high score, but doesn't mind some difficulty.

reviewText:
It's finally here folks, the long awaited sequel to Turbo Pug, THE ELUSIVE SUPER MEGA NEO PUG. What can I say? These developers are geniuses, why didn't more people think to make endless pug based runners sooner?

But in all seriousness this is a very casual and fun game, and can be extremely addicting if you have friends youre competing with, much like the original.

What are the differences between this and the original?

In this your animals are flying!
There are power ups!
There are Boss Fights!
and there are multiple maps to fly through.

Its new but still fun as you guide your pug through asteroids and enemys blocking his path to try and beat your high score.

If I had any problems theyd be that,
1. The music in this sequel is inferior to the original, it's still really good, but I prefer the original.
2. The switching between music everytime you die is a really big change and makes me cringe a little.

Would I recommend this game?
Yes, given the price of 60 cents I think this game deserves at least an 9/10.

reviewText: I LOVE the Developers of Turbo Pug and SuperMega Pug!!! For two games, combined to cost me a bit over a Dollar, I'm getting more fun than ANY 'major' dev/publisher game I spent forty times the cash on!! Both games have immense replay value and awesome enjoyment value. I have 'best friends' that wouldn't offer the same enjoyment...which normally would speak to my choice of friends...but these games really are that awesome. This here game took more of an adjustment to get used to controlling than the first one, yet well worth the short effort. If I ever meet these developers, I would thank them immensely...meantime, I do highly recommend both games!! :D

reviewText: Since this game is literally leftover coins in your pocket value, my expectations were kinda on that same kind of level: low. Yet, for what it's worth, this game is alright. It is not bad, but it is not the best game. If you want a flappy-bird clone ish with dogs and dinos and possible pandas, this game has that stuff. Desert is a bit bright and does not help with the visiblity of the flames, music is cool and unfortunately sometimes ends too early for me to enjoy some funky bass in space. The lifetime of this game is not that long since all one can do to progress is to either beat the leaderboard, unlock some customes and beat some bosses (more outlast a boss). Yet I digress, I got value out of my nickels and dimes for this game.\nIt is alright.

reviewText:
It feels like a free flash game, and those might be more worth your time.

When you start the game it will bring up the Unity launcher, letting you adjust your resolution, graphical settings (which seem to do nothing), and controls. The controls are wasd to move, ctrl, shift, and alt to shoot, and a bunch of other things. Too bad none of those do anything, though, because mouse1 is the only control, in a Flappy Bird style of gameplay. The launcher also will randomly not remember things or change them for no reason, requiring me to restart the game 3 times before the game launches in the correct monitor, then another restart to get the proper resolution.

While the resolution was a square, the black edges of the screen didn't clear the Steam overlay, so whenever I receieved a Steam message or opened Steam in-game, that would stay there forever.

The game also has impassable obstacles that fill the entire screen, and it's not too uncommon. In my 20 minutes of gameplay I had that happen at least twice.

The gameplay itself gets boring almost instantly, with the only goal to Flappy Bird your way past usually dodgable objects and get the highest score. This is the same gameplay in hundreds of free flash games, except this time it costs money, and has less content than many of those free games.

It has some okay music, but every time you die the menu music will instantly start playing so you hear the first second of it over and over, and it's so aggrivating. This would be a fine free flash game, but as a payed game I can't recommend this.

Update: In response to the developer not understanding what I meant by free flash game"
